info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:31PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Glasscock, northeastern Ector, eastern Andrews, northern Midland, southeastern Gaines, western Martin and southwestern Dawson Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Lenorah to 12 miles northeast of Goldsmith. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Andrews, Greenwood, Stanton, Midland International Air and Space Port, West Odessa, Tarzan, Warfield, Midland Airpark, Courtney, Odessa Schlemeyer Field and Andrews County Airport. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 110 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
